conclusion: Analyze processes in the p-V diagram to determine heat absorbed vs. released.
Identify adiabatic processes (c to d and a to b) and isochoric processes (d to a and b to c).
In adiabatic processes, no heat is exchanged (Q = 0).
In isochoric processes, change in internal energy equals heat added or removed (ΔU = Q).
During adiabatic expansion (c to d), gas expands, doing work, decreasing internal energy.
During isochoric cooling (d to a), volume constant, temperature decreases, heat released.
During adiabatic compression (a to b), gas compressed, work done on gas, increasing internal energy.
During isochoric heating (b to c), volume constant, temperature increases, heat absorbed.
Net heat exchange determined by changes in internal energy and work done.
Net change in internal energy over one complete cycle is zero (ΔU_total = 0).
Work done by gas during expansion (c to d) is greater than work done on gas during compression (a to b).
Heat released during isochoric cooling (d to a) is greater than heat absorbed during isochoric heating (b to c).
Final conclusion: Heat absorbed is less than heat released during a complete cycle.
